topic: The American War of Independence to the Crimean War

questions.question: When did the American colonies declare independence from Britain?
questions.explanation: The 13 American colonies declared independence in 1776.

questions.question: How many colonies declared independence in 1776?
questions.explanation: Thirteen colonies declared independence from Britain.

questions.question: What phrase did colonists use to protest British taxes?
questions.explanation: Colonists opposed taxes, demanding 'no taxation without representation.'

questions.question: In what year did Britain recognise American independence?
questions.explanation: Britain recognised the independence of the colonies in 1783.

questions.question: Who led the British fleet at the Battle of Trafalgar?
questions.explanation: Admiral Nelson led the British fleet at Trafalgar in 1805.

questions.question: When was the Battle of Trafalgar fought?
questions.explanation: The Battle of Trafalgar took place in 1805.

questions.question: Where can Nelson’s ship HMS Victory be visited?
questions.explanation: HMS Victory is preserved in Portsmouth.

questions.question: Who defeated Napoleon at the Battle of Waterloo?
questions.explanation: Napoleon was defeated by the Duke of Wellington in 1815.

questions.question: When did Queen Victoria become queen?
questions.explanation: Queen Victoria became queen in 1837.

questions.question: How long did Queen Victoria reign?
questions.explanation: Queen Victoria ruled for almost 64 years, from 1837 to 1901.

questions.question: What was repealed in 1846 to promote free trade?
questions.explanation: The Corn Laws were repealed in 1846 to allow cheaper grain imports.

questions.question: When were women and children limited to 10-hour workdays?
questions.explanation: In 1847, working hours for women and children were limited to 10 per day.

questions.question: Who pioneered the railway engine?
questions.explanation: George and Robert Stephenson pioneered the railway engine.

questions.question: Who built the Great Western Railway?
questions.explanation: Isambard Kingdom Brunel designed and built the Great Western Railway.

questions.question: When was the Great Exhibition held?
questions.explanation: The Great Exhibition took place in 1851 in Hyde Park, London.

questions.question: What was the Crystal Palace made of?
questions.explanation: The Crystal Palace was made of iron and glass.

questions.question: Where was Brunel born?
questions.explanation: Isambard Kingdom Brunel was born in Portsmouth.

questions.question: When was the Crimean War fought?
questions.explanation: The Crimean War took place from 1853 to 1856.

questions.question: Which countries fought with Britain in the Crimean War?
questions.explanation: Britain fought with Turkey and France against Russia.

questions.question: What medal was created during the Crimean War?
questions.explanation: Queen Victoria introduced the Victoria Cross to honour bravery in war.

questions.question: What honour did Florence Nightingale receive in 1907?
questions.explanation: Florence Nightingale was the first woman awarded the Order of Merit in 1907.

questions.question: What impact did Florence Nightingale’s reports have on hospitals?
choices: They inspired reforms in sanitation and hygiene
They led to the closure of many hospitals
They focused only on army training
questions.explanation: Her reports on sanitation and hygiene improved hospital conditions and public health worldwide.
